@ptn 

Monitoring the number of times a fragment was stale or fresh.
```ruby
def monitored_cache(name = {}, options = nil, &block)
  if controller.perform_caching
    safe_concat(monitored_fragment_for(cache_fragment_name(name, options), options, &block))
  else
    yield
  end

  nil
end

def monitored_fragment_for(name = {}, options = nil, &block)
  if fragment = controller.read_fragment(name, options)
    #Do something to incr a count in redis/memecache/etc that shows cache was fresh
    fragment
  else
    #Do something to incr a count in redis/memecache/etc that shows cache was stale
    write_fragment_for(name, options, &block)
  end
end
```

Calling procs if cache is stale.
```ruby
def cache_and_call(name = {}, options = nil, &block)
  if controller.perform_caching
    safe_concat(fragment_for_and_call(cache_fragment_name(name, options), options, &block))
  else
    yield
  end

  nil
end

def fragment_for_and_call(name = {}, options = nil, &block)
   if fragment = controller.read_fragment(name, options)
      fragment
   else
     if options[:proc]
       @proc_results = options[:proc].call
     end
     write_fragment_for(name, options, &block)
   end
end
```
